column1: For Sale:  Akai Custom 9mm major USPSA open pistol
column10: For sale is a custom USPSA open pistol I had built by Shay Akai at Akai Custom. Particulars:9mm MajorV6 Katana modelPhoenix Trinity safetiesC-More aluminum click siteStroked slideI ordered this gun well over 2 years ago. It took about 18-20 months to get it made and delivered and it has now sat comfortably in my safe for about 8 months. This magazine came with the gun from Akai.Also includes a hard case (Pelican type but not branded) that came with the gun.Finally, I have also included in the listed price two MBX 141.25mm magazines (nearly brand new) and a Double Alpha belt with Alpha-X holster and 3 race master pouches. Belt size is 34.I would really like to sell everything together but would consider separating the MBX magazines and Double Alpha rig.If you are looking at this you know the wait time for an Akai gun! Avoid the wait, save dollars, and have it now!Email for more pictures and if you have questions.Price for everything is $6350.

column1: For Sale:  Hornady sonic Brass case Cleaner
column10: A brand NEW Hornady Sonic  Lock-N-Load Brass cleaner, never used, never even pluged up,just opened box for inspection,it cost me about $100 when i bought itcomes with the basket and instruction, they dont include include the liquid cleaning fluid, you have to buy it seperate. While looking for the lock-n-load cleaningfluid i descovered it was for yello brass cases  only.  will not clean Nickel plated cases,will turn the nickle cases Black and ruin them. It is for yello brass and willmake the yellow brass cases look like new.  I am a retired certified NRA Law inforcement Firearms instructor. I am a reloader of over 45 years and have Thousands of nickle plated cases,butonly a few yello brass cases. SO I HAVE NO USE FOR THE SONIC CLEANER!     Will give you a bargain in this new sonic cleaner, at the present this cleaner is onsale at midway for $99   I will sell this one for $ 65.   (face to face)  .If shipp is needed add  $ 15

DEALER TRANSACTIONKeel Mountain Munitions has available a Radom P-64 9 x18 Makarov PistolA little piece of history.The P-64 is a Polish 9x18mm semi-automatic pistol designed to fire the 9—18mm Makarov cartridge. The pistol was developed in the late 1950s at the Institute for Artillery Research (Polish: Zak‚ad Broni Strzeleckiej Centralnego Badawczego Poligonu Artyleryjskiego, which later became the Military Institute of Armament Technology, Polish: Wojskowy Instytut Techniczny Uzbrojenia w Zielonce-WITU) by a team consisting of: W. Czepukajtis, R. Zimny, H. Adamczyk, M. Adamczyk, S. Kaczmarski and J. Pyzel. The P-64 is also known as the CZAK[1] (an acronym of the designers' last names with the exception of J. Pyzel, who joined the team after the name had been established).Double Action Blowback Operated6-round magazine capacitySA/DA with decockerPrinted copy of user's manualComes with 1 magazineDealer transaction, background check and AL sales tax as applicablePrice listed is cash, +4% card transactionShipping to your FFL $25

The DAN could stand for Dan Wesson I guess. $799If interested, I have a bunch of ammo I reloaded (500 rounds of .38 Special) for target shooting. column1: For Sale/Trade:  LIKE NEW GEN 2 GLOCK 21 with 12 Mags
column10: I have a gen 2 Glock 21 that is in LIKE NEW CONDITION.  Comes with 12 LIKE NEW 13 round magazines (some are unused and only 10 are shown in the picture) and a NEW UNUSED Black Arch holster.  The magazines and holster ($75) are a $375 value.  I don't normally sale holsters, but if you have never tried a Black Arch holster, do some research and you will find they are very well known with individuals who love them after carrying every other holster in existence. I used to think Alien Gear holsters were the best, until I tried Black Arch.Now for the Glock.  I bought it off an older individual in 2010 who bought it new in the early 90s.  He NEVER fired it, but unfortunately, he did throw the box out. I sent it to Glock for them to replace all internals, and mill the slide for the new 15 degree extractor.  Gen 2 Glocks have 90 degreemags extractors, which did cause extraction problems in a lot of Glock 21s.  No other gen 2 models were problematic with the 90 degree extractor.  All gen 3, 4, and 5 Glocks have 15 degree extractors.  After, I got it back, I had front cocking serrations added to slide and I had the top of the slide dished out.  Afterwards, the slide, barrel, and extractor were refinished in black cerakote and Glock night sights added.I have many more pics...my cell is 940-923-4385...I am in Tontitown.  We both know a used Glock is not worth $600, but don't forget the 12 like new hi cap mags and quality NEW holster.  Gen 2 Glocks are getting harder to come by, especially in like new condition.

I am offering a 1916 Spanish Mauser chambered in 7.62 NATO (7.62x51). The overall condition of this rifle is very good/excellent . With the exception of the safety lever, all serial numbers match. The condition of the bore is excellent, essentially perfect to my eyes. The previous owner of this rifle skillfully repaired a cracked wrist as well as reblued the firearm, and frankly his work was outstanding. All and all, this is both a cosmetically beautiful and functionally perfect firearm. I got this rifle lumped into a larger trade, and I already have a couple M1916s, so I am selling this one. There is nothing wrong with the gun.A word about Spanish M1916 Mausers:If you are knowledgable about 1916 Mauser's, you will be pleased to learn that this particular rifle was originally purchased from SAMCO in the 1990's. This rifle is NOT one of the bottom of the barrel rejects which recently flooded the market after SAMCO's liquidation sale. Additionally, the previous owner was a knowledgable man and fired low pressure handloads through this rifle, so it was not abused by full power .308 in the way that others like it have been.If you are not familiar with the M1916 rifle, you should be aware that there is great debate on the history and proper chambering of these rifles. I won't turn this classified ad into a history lesson, but here is the main takeaway: This is a military rifle chambered in a military cartridge (7.62 NATO). This rifle is NOT chambered for the American hunting cartridge .308 Winchester, and although many claim to fire large amounts of such rounds without incident, it is generally regarded as potentially unsafe. I say it is not worth taking the risk. Additionally, this rifle is not chambered for 7.62 CETME, as some others claim.The bottom line is that this is a historic military firearm. Unlike a modern commerical hunting rifle, it wasn't designed to be idiot proof. Unlike its descendant the Mauser 98, it wasn't built like a tank. For someone who understands the capabilities and limitations of a small ring Mauser however, its a highly capable and versatile tool.  Whether as a deer rifle, a truck gun, a target rifle, or all of the above, this lightweight short rifle can be loaded to safely and reliable perform in many roles. Definitely an interesting collectable as well.Leather sling is included. Better pictures available on request, don't hestitate to ask questions.

column1: For Sale:  W.W. Greener 10 ga. side by side box lock with ejectors, 1882
column10: This W.W. Greener 10 gauge boxlock “Monarch” Model shotgun was made in 1879 for W.H. Linthicum from Baltimore, MD.  Mr. Linthicum was known for being an expert sharpshooter, president of The Baltimore Gun Club, and an avid competitor.  This special gun has 32" barrels, Anson & Deeley actioned gun with a Greener Cross Bolt and Side Safety. , and shell ejectors, which were revolutionary at this time.  It has beautiful scrolling, clean bores, and nice wood.  If you are a collector of historically significant guns associated with the first family of Baltimore, then this gun is the Holy Grail.  In the attached pictures is one of W.H. Linthicum cleaning and holding this very gun.  The gun is inscribed, "W.H. Linthicum, Baltimore, Maryland" on it from the W.W. Greener factory.

column1: For Sale:  Probably the most pristine Raven you will ever find. Great small 25 ACP concealed carry pistol.
column10: I am a FFL dealer.. This pistol is from my Personal Collection. I acquired it several years before I became a dealer. I doubt that it was ever shot prior to my acquiring it. Since I've owned it probably put a hundred rounds through. It always works. No matter what ammo I use, it never has a misfeed. Like all Ravens, this is strictly for up-close-and-personal work. No 3-inch groupings with this model firearm. That's just the nature of the beast. For years I've used it for shirt pocket carry. Just took a pristine Guardian 32 ACP pistol in trade that is going to be assuming that role. Now, if you have about $450, you too probably should opt for a guardian, but if you don't have that much cash to spend for an occasional carry pistol, then this raven would be a great option. I know I have the original box and possibly some paperwork to go along with the gun. I think the box is a little crushed, but still decent shape.

column1: For Sale:  Classic Smith and Wesson Model 66 Revolver
column10: For sale we have a very clean and collectible Smith and Wesson Model 66-3 revolver in .357 Magnum chambering, with the highly desirable 2.5 inch barrel. This 25 year old revolver is from the days when Smith and Wesson made handcrafted firearms, before the use of MIM parts, and long before the days of the ridiculous internal safety lock of current models.This excellent revolver belongs to my best friend who has owned it since he bought it new in 1992. He doesn't really want to part with it, but some vehicle repair expenses make it necessary. The revolver comes with Hogue rubber grips, a pair of custom wood grips, and a nice leather belt holster. This model in this barrel length is very hard to find these days, and would be equally at home on the firing range or as part of a collection. I owned this revolver briefly in 2014, and sent it back to the factory for a thorough cleaning and adjustment, so it is in excellent condition. I'm handling the sale for my friend because his work schedule makes it difficult for him to show the pistol.The revolver can be seen by appointment only at my office just outside of Homestead. Please be aware that since I am listing this for my friend and do not own it, I have limited flexibility on price, and am unable to consider any trades on this firearm. Sorry about that. Face to face transactions only, no shipping. All laws complied with in this sale. Thank you for looking at this listing.

column1: For Sale:  AR-15 .458 socom, and 6.5 Grendel
column10: Trying to come up with the down on a house, so im selling off my meager firearms collection.I built this rifle last year, and have used it on the Feral Cattle hunt with the .458 upper, and for goats here, and deer on molokai with the 6.5 Grendel upper.The .458 is a hammer, it drives 300grn hornady JHPs, or Nosler MZ Balistic tips to 1950, and 405grn Rem softpoints at 1650. I used the 405s to drop two wild bulls with one shot each, bang flops, fastest drops ive seen on this critters besides one i hit with a 175grn from my 7mm STW.The 6.5 Is point and click death on smaller game out to 300yds or so, and longer hits are possible but i havent done anything besides shoot rocks father out.The loads i use are 123Amax/SST at 2500fps, and 100gr Balistic tips at 2770. Recoil on this round is also low, and with the muzzle break attatched the same as a hot loaded 5.56specs on the gunAnderson Multi LowerJP reduced power spring kit (totaly reliable)Polished Mil-spec trigger, hammer and disconectorTrigger engagment adjustable Grip screwI cant rember who made the grip thats on it, but it fits well and is comfortable. Also included is the original ATI scorpion i had on the gun, that grip is VERY comfortable if you have large hand, but was hard for folks with smaller hands to use.The stock, is an ATI ultralite, with the cheek riser. The riser gets in the way of the operating handle unless the stock is fully extended, but i prefer the looks of the gun with it on so ive lived with having to open the stock to charge the rifle. If you want to remove it its only a couple screws on each side. Not pictured but included is the larger heavier recoil pad that does a wonderful job soaking up the hit from the .458, tho even with just the padding i put on the back of the regular ati stock its pretty mild.I also have an extra power buffer spring, and extra heavy buffer which is nice with the .458 but not necessary. The grendThe .458 upper is from Radical, and features their upgraded 15" freefloat tube, as well as the Panzer brake. Ive recently gone to a Hogue non over molde 13" tube handguard as the pic rails were hanging up on brush. I still have the longer Hybrid rail which can be purchased for $60Bolt is matched to the barrel and is MPI/HPT tested.Ive got probably 300rounds on this upper, and its functioned flawlessly.The scope is a Bushnell Legend Ultra HD 1.75-6x32 with a shotgun doa reticle. The reticle tracks pretty closely to the loads im running in the gun.6.5 Grendel upper is one i put together myself.The reciever is an ultralite smoothside, Spartan from Joebobs. Tbarrel and bolt are from Radical and matched, 20" 1-8 twist so if your inclined you COULD shoot the heaviest bullets available, but ive stuck with 100-123s. The barrel was turned down to an ultralite profile by Ar15barrels.13" Slim profile Matrixarms keylock handguard. I also changed this to 15" Matrix HandguardThe upper comes with a break that works really well, but is quite load, and an aluminum barrel shroud for use when hunting (or to keep from annoying fellow shooters with the muzzle blast). I also have a thread protector should you want to run without either.Topped with a 1.5-5x20 Brunton Eterna, this scope is lite and offers plenty of magnification for shots out to the edge of what i would consider ethical range for the 6.5 cartridge. Glass on this scope is excellent and the finger adjustable turrets, actually make dailing shots in at range surprisingly easy.I have 4 or 5 mags for the .458, it uses standard 5.56mags. Some of them have modified followers which allows a full 5 rounds in a 10rnd magazine, these will NOT work as 5.56s mags unless the followers are replaced.I only have 1 mag for the Grendel. The front its notched to allow bullets to be seated out to 2.34" which actually makes a difference in this small case. If you use the longer OAL than it only holds 5-7 rounds, cant remeber off hand. If you use shorter oals or factory bullets, you can fit a full 10.The gun comes with Dies for both calibers. I am keeping the components for the .458, but ill give the buyer what ever 6.5 stuff i have left.Both guns pictures will be changed when i get a chance to take new ones.questions etc drop me a line8083152000Keao

column1: For Sale:  browning abolt 7mm remington 4-12x40 Nikon PRICE DROP
column10: This rifle was my dream gun since highschool, and has been my primary hunting gun for about 6 years. Ive shot cows, deer, sheep, goats, and a random pig or two with it. Its also chambered in my all time favorite cartridge the 7mm remington magnum.The guns a basic Browning Abolt2 in 7mm remington, but its been bedded into a Eurobolt stock. The scope is a Nikon Prostaff 4-12x40, but if prefered could be replaced (for a bit more money) with a 4.5-14x40 Nikon Buckmasters.The magazine has been modified to allow longer cartridge over all length on handloads (still functions fine with factory rounds), and my pet load drives a 162 amax to 3050 from the guns 26" barrel.The stock is on the long side (at 6'2 it fits me  perfectly), but again if the buyer wants i can shorten it to any length of pull desired, and refit the recoil pad.This comes with a small supply of loaded ammo, and cases, bullets and reloading dies.keao 8083152000

column1: For Sale:  Custom savage 10, .250 Savage Ackley Improved, Bushnell Legend Ultra Hd 4.5-14x44
column10: I just finished building this rifle a few months ago, and have only shot 60 rounds so far.This gun has proven to be capable of sub MOA accuracy with 115 berger right out of the gate. My current load drives the 115s to 3100fps, and best groups hover around .5" at 100yds.Specs on the gunCustom .250AI barrel, 26" 1-10 twistSharp Shooter Supply overeized recoil lug in stainlessBall bearing bolt mod with stainless spacerSmooth barrel.nutCustom AA fancy stock hand fitted and oil finishedOld school Pachmayr vented  trap type padBushnell legend ultra hd scope is mounted in weaver quadlock rings, the scope also featurea a MilDot reticle.Ive completed load development for the 115 berger vlds, and superformance powder. Final loads shot under 1" and at just over 3100fps.This rifle was built by, for me, and lives upto my expectations of a long range sheep and deer rig. Its heavy enough to be steady, but still fairly easy to carry. The LOP is on the long side, but i can shorten the stock and refit the pad if the buyer wants.The gun comes with some formed brass, and some ammo. As well as hornady necksizing, and bullet seating dies.Gimme a call or text with any questions3152000Keao Yuen

column1: For Sale:  Remington 700 custom 6x47, simmons whitetail expedition 3-9x42
column10: Another one of my custom rifles. This gun is one ive owned for a long time, the finish is worn (infact its just paint till i order more duracoat), there are some pits in the barrel and the stock is dinged up. This gun has also killed dozens of head of game.Mid 90s Remington 700 action, trued and polished, updated xmark pro trigger.24" 1-10 twist ErShaw custom 6x47rem barrel (basically the same thing as the 6x45 but doesnt use the same case).ErShaw also did the action work.Boyds Classic stock with the walnut upgrade. This stock was purchased unfinished and i did a oil rub on it.Simmons 3-9x42 Whitetail expedition in remington rings with flip up caps.The scope is probably the best scope simmons ever produced. These compare well with mid range leupolds.This gun is amazingly versatile, and low in recoil. The basic ideas been used again with the 25x45 sharps, but the 6mm bullets have some advantages.I use two loadings in this gun for everything from goats to pigs and deer.85grn sierra game king at 2850 for lighter stuff, and 100grn sierra gameking at 2650 for deer and pigs.The gun comes with hornady dies, and a supply of already sized .222 rem mag and 204 ruger brass.Questions etc3152000Keao

column1: For Sale:  Springfield XD .45 Tactical set up to shoot .45 SUPER
column10: Just finished setting this gun up about two months ago, and have shot it quite a bit since. My wife and I are looking at buying a house, so im thining the collection to help fund that. Other wise I would not be selling it.The guns has a number of upgrade parts, some for the basic .45acp configuration, and some for running the .45 SUPER loads I use.Parts that are in the gunPowder River Sear, and Match/Target triggerSpringer precision 1911 guide rod with wolf 24Lb, and 28Lb extra power recoil springsWolff extra power Firing pin springWolff extra power Magazine spring in one mag, stock spring in the other (didnt find the mag springs necessary so did change the second one)5.71" Threaded StormLake match stainless barrel with LoneWolf .460 Rowland muzzle break, recontoured for the smaller XD slide. I did this myself, so its not perfect, but does look pretty good.TPA SIG Fully adjustable, white outline, target sights.Parts included with the gunstandard XD 5" barrelStandard hollow recoil spring guidWolff heavy weight Recoil spring guide18Lb stock spring20Lb Wolff extra power spring....This can be used with standard ACP loads, as well as lower end .45Super loads.CMB Razor tactical muzzle brake. This break looks cleaner on the pistol than the LW brake does, but dosent do as good a job at attenuating the recoil generated by top end .45Super loads.Ok so a little history on the pistol, and the reason for the parts etc.Ive owned the gun for a while, and have spent quite a bit of time and energy on it. The pistols fun, accurate, and with the correct loading VERY powerful.The parts ive added are all basicly to duplicate the .460 Rowland, but with a standard .45 ACP chamber, which allows the use of regular ACP rounds without swaping barrels (cause taking off the muzzle breaks is annoying). With the different guids, and springs, the gun can be tailored to run reliably with anything from regular 230 ball rounds at 850 upto (and exceeding, tho i never felt the need), 230s loaded to 1250FPS in the correct .45 super brass.Right now the gun is set up with the LW break and 24# spring, which allows it to comfortably handle all but the weakest .45ACP ammo, as well as what became my standard loadings of 200grn XTPs at 1250 (the 230s didnt seem to work any better and recoiled quite a bit more).I will include my load data, reloading dies, and what components i have left.thanksKeao8083152000

column1: For Sale:  Browning Citori Upland Special 12ga, choke set. F/S/T

column1: For Sale:  Bergara B-14 Timber 30-06 Nikon Buckmaster 3-9x40 PRICE DROP
column10: Selling stuff to buy a house...This is one of those guns I had seen on the internet and REALLY wanted, so i had Stubes order one for me a few months ago.This is basically a modified, Remington 700 with some extra features and much better quality control.it will take the same stocks, bottom metal/magazines, scope mounts, etc that a 700 long action will take. The changes are a simpler trigger design, side bolt catch, and a different bolt geometry, and extractor....i much prefer this to the original 700, which ive have 3 of.The scope thats on the gun is a Nikon Buckmasters (not the lowerend Buckmasters 2), Its mounted in Talley liteweight rings.This gun is not the most accurate i own, but with handloads it will consistently shoot 1-1.25 moa. Ive shot it out to 300, but havent had a chance to shoot it farther.Ive installed a Limbsaver pad, and refinished the stock.You want a rifle that will do almost anything from mongoose to moose, without breaking your shoulder this would be a good choice, if perhaps a little old schoolI have dies, brass and some bullets available if the buyer wants to purchase those as well.Any questions etc give me a call/text3152000Keao

I am the second owner of this rifle, which was built completely by Alan (AJ) Brown of Crane, who builds these rifles for NSW, in January 2012. It is built on an accurized Remington 700 long action receiver using a 26.5” Lilja match grade barrel (1:10). The barrel is threaded and tapered to accept an Ops Inc., 3rd Model suppressor, and includes the thread protector. The previous owner had one and used it with great success. I had the suppressor on order before it became necessary to sell this rifle. The trigger is factory Remington, tuned to approximately 3.5lbs of pull. The bolt features the M16 extractor modification and a Badger bolt knob. It has Badger bottom metal and comes with one Accuracy International (AI) 5 round magazine. The rail is also Badger Ordnance, 20 MOA cant. It includes the bipod adapter, but not the bipod. The action is fully bedded into an FDE duracoated McMillan A5 fully adjustable stock. The action is duracoated olive drab. The rifle is fitted with the oversized recoil lug developed for this rifle.The rifle is in excellent condition. The previous owner put approximately 100 rounds through it, and I put exactly 60 through it.. Recoil is surprisingly light, as this is a heavy rifle. USPS MO, Certified Funds. No trades please.

column1: For Sale/Trade:  ultra rare Saiga 20 loaded with extras
column10: Please read this entire ad before responding: Yes, it is still for sale (to answer the 15 people who write every ad with no intention of buying anything). No, I will not take a beat up dirt bike, washing machine, or half a lawn mower for it. Gun trades worth at least $1250 only, unless it's high end electronics greatly in my favor.  If the ad is up without note, it's available for sale.  Do not send an email asking for any other info without sending your FOID and DoB over. If you are serious about making a deal, you will send your FOID info for an ISP check. No time wasters or window shoppers. Price is firm.Up for sale or trade is a gorgeous and rare early Saiga 20, with pauly's steelin custom charging handle and carrier polishing ($350 upgrade). Converted trigger group ($150). Upgraded recoil spring ($20). Comes with railed polymer foregrip ($50), polymer skeleton stock ($50), 2 5 round factory mags, adjustable gas system ($120), and 2 extended aftermarket mags ($50 each). May have a steel mag around as well. Runs fantastically with any 3 dram+ 20 gauge ammo, including birdshot. Takes 2 3/4" and 3" shells (magazines are 2 3/4, but 3" mags are out there). Stongly considering keeping this, so I will not haggle on the price at all. These do not come up for sale often, and I am not 100% sure I want to part with it. Price is fair and firm. These are getting harder and harder to find.$975 cash (firm), $1250 trade valuePlease send over your FOID number and date of birth when getting in contact, and I'll run the ISP check and we can meet 24 hours later (as per illinois state law). No tire kickers, not willing to drive any more than about a half hour to meet anyone for a sale.

column1: For Sale:  Winchester M1 Garand Tanker
column10: This is a mixed parts M1. Winchester receiver serial number 1203xxx. From what I can find it is from May of 1942. It has a trigger group stamped 6528290 HRA N. Op rod is Springfield Armory D 35382 9 SA.  Bolt is stamped D 6528287 IHC. I have looked everywhere and can not see a stamp on the barrel.  It is 18 3/8".  Also includes 176 rounds of ammo. 16 loaded en bloc clips and 48 loose rounds. I'll throw in the ammo can. Headstamp is F N 58.I picked this up from a local FFL I know about 15 years ago. I haven't gotten around to shooting it so it might as well go.  I know you all want to hear who did the conversion so I will tell you I have no idea. I realize that will be a sticking point for a lot of people but it is what it is. In my experience folks either like and want a tanker or hate them with a passion. No real middle ground.Cash only, no trades.  Will consider reasonable offers.I am in Champaign and due to circumstances and work can't drive very far to meet. It would have to be in the evening if we do. All laws and regulations will be followed. At least a 24 hour wait from when I run your foid through the ISP website. I will not ship. If needed I will try and send interested parties better pics. Email with questions. Thanks!

All laws and waiting periods apply. In Champaign and cannot travel to deliver. You must come here for pick up. At this time I will not ship. Email with questions. Thanks!To clarify, I will not sell to an out of state resident even if you are willing to drive here for pick up. A sale to an out of state resident would have to go through an FFL on the buyers end. And I am not Willing to go that route. You must be an Illinois resident with a valid foid card.  The waiting period is 72 hours from the time I get an approval from ISP.

Selling my Ruger Mark 1 Mag-Na-Port Bullseye. Unfired.  Made in 1979, there were only 200 produced. This is number 20. Has a 5 inch bull barrel, finished in Metalife SS. Clark steel trigger. Ported with gold outline rear sight. Mag-Na-Port etched into rear of the bolt. Gold bullseye on right side of frame. One 10 round mag. Was sold in a wood display case. I have the case but the inside has been redone and the outside has marks and shows wear. I can only post 3 pics but will send more to serious buyers. I encourage you to research this item on your own. It is a rare piece.I am in Champaign and I will not ship. You will have to pick it up here. All laws and regulations will be followed. Pick up at least 72 hours from when I run your foid through the ISP website. Cash only, not looking to trade. Email with questions. Thanks.

column1: For Sale:    Magnum Research DE44CA Desert Eagle MK XIX Mark 19
column10: Make: Magnum ResearchModel: Desert Eagle (MK XIX)Serial Number: 43203735Year of Manufacture: Circa 2010. The magazine is marked 7/08, there is a CA Approved Shipment Sticker dated 4/21/2014.Caliber: .44 Magnum, additional .50 AE (action express) barrelAction Type: Single Action, Semi-Automatic, Removable Magazine Fed Pistol with Rotating BoltMarkings: The left side of the barrel is marked “.44”, the left side of the slide is marked “DESERT EAGLE PISTOL ® / MAGNUM RESEARCH INC. PILLAGER MN USA", the right is marked “ISRAEL WEAPON INDUSTRIES (IWI) LTD. / MADE IN ISRAEL”. The right side of the frame is marked with the serial number. The grip panels have the IWI logo, the magazine has 5 witness holes marked from 4 to 8 and is also marked “7/08 / 44”. The original factory box is serialized to the pistol and reflects its configuration.Barrel Length: 6”Sights / Optics: The front sight is a serrated ramp blade, which is dovetailed onto the slide. The rear sight is a square notched base that is dovetailed onto the rear of the slide. The top of the barrel has two slots for the addition of a red dot or scope rings (not included).Stock Configuration & Condition: The grips are a two piece black rubber stock set with pebbling and smooth bordering, which wraps around the back strap of the grip frame. The stocks are free from major damages. The backstrap has an imperfection from the mold at the seam. It is intact, no cracking or splitting. The stocks rate in about Excellent overall condition.Type of Finish: Black OxideFinish Originality: OriginalBore Condition: The bore is bright and the polygonal rifling is well formed. There is no erosion in the bore. this condition is consistent with the .50 AE bore.Overall Condition: This handgun retains about 99% of its metal finish. Only the faintest marks are visible on the exterior surfaces. Only a few areas of the internals show operational wear. There is light loss to the edges of the safety lever. This pistol looks to have been used infrequently and was well taken care of in the interim. The screw heads are sharp. The markings are crisp. Overall, this handgun rates in about Excellent condition.Mechanics: The action functions correctly. We did not fire this handgun. As with all used firearms, a thorough cleaning may be necessary to meet your maintenance standards.Box, Paperwork & Accessories: Included is a .50 AE barrel and magazine in the factory plastic case with end label matching the gun. The barrel is in excellent condition, both the bore and exterior. There are a few light scratches from previous assembly and disassembly.

Hungarian made FEG, Model GKK-45 that comes with a single-stack magazine.  If you like the slide-mounted safety/decocker of the Beretta, P-38 and the old school S&W pistols, you can appreciate it here on this fine pistol.  It appears to be a hybrid of the Brownig Hi-Power and the S&W 39 series pistol designs - inside and out.  These old world quality-crafted firearms are getting harder and harder to find and supplies are drying up.  The labor intensive machining processes required to manufacture SKS rifles, Makarovs and pistols like these are too cost prohibitive to reproduce these classics ever again.  These quality-machined All Steel firearms aren't in production anymore and when the supplies dry up, they won't be replaced.Concealed carry or pistol purchasing permit and driver's license will be required during a face-to-face transfer, unless shipment is to be arranged through an FFL.**********************************************************I would consider trading for a Rossi Ranch Hand.  Please check out the other things I have advertised here on Armslist by hitting the "Listings by this user" button.

Ever wanted to own a piece of the Old West?Now is your chance.Here is a Winchester Model 1892.... Still in great condition for a rifle this old.Shoots very straight, very tight and looks great.Cal is 38/40.125 years and still going strong.2017 marks the 125th year of the Model 1892. Of all the rifles produced in an era often called 'the Winning of the West' the John Browning-designed Winchester Model 1892 stands out as an engineering masterpiece. Light, fast, ultra quick to the point, natural . . . . essentially perfect. Of all the pistol caliber rifles of the day, none have become more viable in modern Cowboy Action shooting than the '92. It's a good year to get your hands on some history.The favorite of the Duke and just about all the cowboy actors. 'Fill your hands you . . . ' The Model 92 was elevated to the status of movie star for three quarters of a Century by many of the most famous on-screen cowboys. When you saw a movie with John Wayne, or watched The Rifleman with Chuck Connors you knew that the rifle they used was more than a screen prop. Going back in time, Annie Oakley performed across the world with Buffalo Bill shooting her special smoothbore 1892.$2,900.00  Firm PriceOnly serious contacts....  PLease.

column1: For Sale:  Bushmaster (pre rubbish) AR-15, 1-4x28 scope, MI and Magpul Equipment, Discreet Carry Case, & More
column10: Up for sale is one Bushmaster upper build. The barrel, BCG, and upper receiver are from one of the last Bushmaster NATO uppers made before the company went downhill. 5.56mm chambering, M4 feed ramps, 1-9 twist, 1/2x28 threading, has lug for launcher attachment, chrome lined chamber/barrel. Forged upper flat top receiver. The forearm is from Midwest Industries and is the SSG2 12" free floating version with key mod attach points. Currently has smooth cover panels in OD green all over with three small rail sections on the outermost points by the muzzle end. Magpul mini foregrip. Midwest Industries .750 low profile gas block (will come with special wrench to remove barrel nut). Vortex low profile one piece solid scope mount topped with a Bushnell AR223 1-4x28 scope with light up first focal plane reticle (round hood type with bdc hash marks) as well as the "throw down lever" for quick magnification adjustment. BCG had properly staked gas key. And charging handle is a BCM medium size extended charging handle. Lower is a basic Anderson lower with a PSA enhanced polished trigger kit and then regular PSA lower parts kit build with milspec sized buffer tube and carbine spring and buffer. Back plate has quick detach point for the included Magpul MS4 sling. Magpul stock and grips also in OD green. Comes with one Magpul mag. Also this rifle will come in the discreet "guitar" case made to carry this rifle. Shoulder strap or pull out backpack straps. Has two mag pouches inside main compartment. What you see is what you get. I'm only able to meet on the weekends locally. Asking $1,050. Email or text 8four3, four8zero, 31zeroniner.

Here is your chance to own an extremely rare Star 30M, new in the box. It includes three factory Interarms magazines valued at $100 each. Check gunbroker.com for yourself. These guns sold for over $500 in the eighties and nineties, they are completely forged frame, barrel and slide. They are Spanish military and police guns and still issued. You can pass them down through the generations. To get comparable quality you would have to get a Colt or a Kimber for the forged quality. The gun actually nearly won the contract for the US military sidearm but lost to the M9 because it was lighter aluminum construction. They shoot like a dream. This is one of the last high capacity wonder nines, it's capacity is 15+1.

I built this for home defense. I went to go shooting it with my wife and she is pretty put off by the blast and is preferring me to sell it to invest in other firearms (see trade section).Specs:- 10.5" melonited 4150 barrel, 1:7 twist, carbine length gas in 5.56- free float handguard low profile handguard- Kaw Valley Linear Comp (Actually makes the blast pretty mild from the shooters perspective)- adjustable gas block (not really necessary though, it's completely open and is gassed perfectly, initally tested with PMC 55gr bronze)- nickle boron BCG with MPI tested bolt- BCM lower parts kit- BCM PNT trigger group (polished, nickled, tefloned)- BCM Mod3 pistol grip- KAK shockwave blade and tube (the nicer tube with the notches specifically for the KAK blade)- Bushnell red dot.- regular carbine buffer, PSA lower and Right To Bear upper receiver.It only has about 100 rounds through it and has run flawlessly on PMC Bronze 55gr, Tula 55gr and American Eagle 5.56. I doubt you'll have any issues with anything else. It's quite accurate for a pistol as well. I've been able to consistently hit an 10" gong at 200 yards with it.All this being said, this is a pistol and is registered as such. So a CPL+RI-010 or purchase permit is required to purchase/trade. I feel that $650 is pretty fair.

Holds 7 rounds in the cylinder and if you didn't already know this is one of the few revolvers out there that can actually be suppressed, so it's a pretty interesting design. Pistol works great and still has a good clean bore and overall finish is very nice. Seems to have been rearsenaled at some point in its life likely sometime around WWII so it's still just about perfect.For whatever reason this example is missing the double action fly and spring, both of which are available cheaply ($13 for the fly for example) from buymilsurp(dot)com. Without those two small parts the pistol still works fine but is simply restricted to single action only, which some of these were naturally manufactured as such anyways.Included are the original holster, lanyard, and cleaning tools.Asking $275 for the package deal. No shipping. Lowered the price a little as I figure if you elect to buy the two small missing parts to restore DA function it'll probably run you about $25 from the aforementioned supplier.Contact me via text at: 231-690-067fiveThanks

column1: For Sale:  WWI Colt 1911 and rig
column10: WWI Colt "Black Army" 1911This Colt Model of 1911 has a 440K serial number and dates to 1918.  It is referred to as a "Black Army" because of what was originally a crude, brushed blued finish during late WWI production.  It has "AA" markings which indicate an "Augusta Arsenal" overhaul sometime after 1918.  Likely this is where the arched mainspring housing was installed and the GI plastic grips took the place of the original wood grips.  Sometime after separating from service, the family of the vet tells me their dad decided to have the slide and frame hot-blued.  The barrel (marked "P" and "H" on the chamber hood) is in excellent original condition and did not get refinished.Other than the mainspring housing and plastic grips, all other parts appear to be original WWI Colt production.  Though many exterior markings are faint, they are all present and the pistol shoots reliably and quite accurately despite the very fine early 1911 sights.I've got several accessories that should stay with the pistol.  They are all GI but were WWII issue.  Includes:1942 Boyt GI flapped holster in excellent condition3 GI 1911 magazines (one marked "L")Canvass GI 1911 double magazine pouch1911 WWII shoulder holster that has a very "been there, done that" field maintained appeal$1500 for all.15 minutes north of downtown St. Paul.

column1: For Sale:  Smith & Wesson  model 17-3,  22 cal, NIB
column10: For Sale: My S&W K-22 Masterpiece model  17-3, 22 caliber, blue 6" bbl. This gun was purchased in the mid 70's.  It is still in its original box with warranty card, papers & cleaning kit.  This gun has never been fired.  It has a pinned barrel, recessed cyclinder & 3 screw frame.  This particular gun comes with a target trigger, target hammer & target grips.  This is a very rare combination to find.Here's what they said about it on Gun Values Board:The K-22 Model 17-3 was shipped from the factory in 1969. It will have a 3 screw frame and a pinned barrel. The dash 3 was in production from 1967 until 1977.These are very fine target .22 revolvers - some say the best production .22 revolver made in America. They tend to be very accurate and are extremely durable guns.The K-22 was part of Smith & Wesson's Masterpiece series, introduced after WWII (in 1947).

column1: For Sale:  HK USP Compact .45 Caliber Pistol
column10: For Sale: HK USP .45 Compact Pistol. Variant 1 SA/DA, decocking lever on the left side, with four 8 round factory HK magazines. Firearm is adult owned from a smoke free home and well maintained and never abused. I will not separate any of the items listed in this ad. No trades, best offers, partial payments, or holds. I do not need help in selling this firearm so no phishing scams. My price is $600 FIRM & CASH ONLY (FIRST PERSON WITH THE ENTIRE AMOUNT IN CASH WILL OWN IT). I am willing to ship this firearm out of state to your licensed and current FFL dealer, however, you will be required to pay for all shipping and FFL fees to get it to you.PLEASE NOTE: This is your last chance to purchase this high quality firearm at a great price before I list it on Gun Broker. Anything less than $600 and I will simply keep it so save your time with any offers, request for trades etc. Must be 21 and have a valid driver license with either a current Nebraska Purchase Permit or a CCW- NO EXCEPTIONS.From the HK website: CALIBER - .45, OVERALL LENGTH- 7.09 in., OVERALL HEIGHT – 5.04 in., OVERALL WIDTH- 1.38 in., BARREL LENGTH – 3.78 in., SIGHT RADIUS – 5.63 in. The HK USP Compact is a small frame pistol capable of firing the most powerful cartridges .45 ACP. Based on the full-size USP models, these handy pistols combine compact size with optimum effective shooting performance. USP Compacts are smaller and lighter than large frame USPs. The reduction in trigger reach and grip circumference increases concealability and enhances shooting ergonomics. Unlike some subcompact semiautomatic pistols that use a difficult to shoot “two-finger grip” frame, the USP Compact uses a narrow, full-hand grip frame with a choice of interchangeable extended or flush-fitting magazine floorplates. This makes the pistol easy to shoot without sacrificing concealability.Like their large frame predecessors, USP Compacts are designed with the demanding needs of the law enforcement and military shooters in mind. Using a modified linkless Browning-type action, the USP Compact is built to take the punishment of high-energy +P loads. To reduce the length of the slide and barrel on the USP Compact, the mechanical recoil reduction system found on large frame USPs has been replaced by a specially designed flat compression spring contained in the captive recoil spring assembly by a polymer absorber bushing. Service life is still engineered to exceed 20,000 rounds. Easy to shoot, simple to maintain; the USP Compact is a reliable, safe, accurate, and highly concealable pistol.

In 1941, they changed to bcd. An unusual combination of proofs can be seen on this rifle: lower case " i ", capital " I " , 1, e, 221, 749, 18, E/1, E/4, E/18, a, n,I do not think such a mix of proofs can be seen on rifles from other makers.You can see E/4 proofs on some of the small parts, perhaps using BSW parts.E/4 and B are on the cross bolt, clearly using an existing BSW part.Note that the rounded " 3 "is used everywhere on this rifle.By an unusual coincidence, you can compare the many different, seemingly random ways that Gustloff proofed their rifles by looking at these 2 additional 1940 337.Mechanically smooth, excellent bore.No import marks, no duffel cut,Pay with USPS money order or certified check.Shipping by USPS Priority Mail, 3 day return if rifle is not exactly as shown in, If you have a C&R, I can ship to you.Otherwise, I will need your ffl dealer's information.

column1: For Sale:  AR pistol, Aero Precision, FDE new
column10: This is a new, unfired (except at the factory) Aero Precision 7.5" pistol.  It is factory cerecoated at the factory.  Both the upper and lower receivers are AP's Enhanced E2 proprietary upgrades to a standard AR.  The lower has a Generation 2 set screw for adjusting the tension between the upper and lower for a perfect fit.  The upper receiver is over-molded adding more metal to the receiver, and designed for the handguard to be bolted (8 bolts) directly to the upper.  This allows for perfect alignment between the two, and making a bomb-proof attachment.  A black foam rubber cushion is added to the buffer tube.  A flashcan is a must addition for these type pistols.MagPul accessories include:Pistol grip, FDEFore-grip, BlkPicatinny rail, 4"Single-point sling-attachement, receiver plateMagazine, FDESights, scope, ammo, accessories available upon request

column1: For Sale:  M1C Garand Sniper rifle
column10: This is an original M1C Garand sniper rifle, released by CMP with "Letter of Authenticity".  The Griffin & Howe scope base is serial numbered to the rifle.  The barrel is marked SA 3-52 and gauges at the muzzle less than 1.  The rear sights are original WWII lock-bar.  Comes in a CMP gun case with all issued paperwork.Have additional accessories to complete a sniper set-up if desired.  Email for more pics.

column1: For Sale:  AR Pistol, 5.56 short-stroke, new
column10: This is a new, unfired (except at the factory) PSA AR pistol in .223/5.56.  It has a 7 in. 1/7 twist barrel with a 9" M-lok rail and a KAK flash can.  The short-stroke buffer design is made by Ginsmoke, Inc. , making this the shortest AR pistol available.  The end plate is an ambidexrous single-point sling adaptor for ease of carry and deployment.  Comes with one USGI 30-rd magazine.Other AR accessories (scope, sights, sling, ammo, forearm, cleaning kit, etc.) available upon request.

column1: For Sale:  AR rifle, LRB 16" chrome-lined 2-tone, new
column10: This is a new, unfired M4A4 AR-15 carbine, with a 16" chrome-lined barrel, 1/7" twist.  Chrome-lined bores triple the life the rifle, and protect it from corrosion. Made by LRB, most famous for their hammer-forged M-14s.  The custom Midway Industries handguard comes with additional rails for adding accessories such as flashlights and bipods.  The HG has been cerakoted in FDE.  The furniture is Command Arms (CCA) in FDE to balance out the 2-tone colors.  The grip has 6 interchangeable panels for a perfect hand-to-grip placement.  Comes with one USGI mag.Additional accessories (sights, scopes, slings, mags, ammo, cleaning kit, etc) available upon request.Yes, if you are reading this it is available.  And no trades at this time.

column1: For Sale:  M14 .308 SOCOM in desert, new
column10: This is a new, unfired Smith Enterprises M14 with a 16" barrel.  It is made with all USGI parts.  The muzzle brake is Smith's own Coast Guard design, which is the best available.  The USGI stock has been Duracoated in a desert pattern to match the area; but other stocks are available upon request.  SEI made their receivers out of hammer-forged steel, and was the primary government contractor for the M14 rifle and supressors.  These are no longer in production, thus only going up in value.  Comes with one magazine.Other accessories (ammo, scopes, mounts, rings, cleaning kit, etc) available upon request.No trades.

This is a National Match 1903 made by Springfield Armory (the government one) back in 1920.  These were issued and sold to participants (yes, the government sold guns directly to the public) of the Camp Perry matches back in the '20s and '30s.  What makes this a NM?  First it has a numbered bolt marked N.S. for nickeled steel.  Secondly, it has a serrated, target trigger; and a fine cross-etched NM butt plate w/trap.  The top handguard is stamped with the NM stock # D28179.  The rear sight is marked to 2800 yards, with the extra (NM) notch on top to take you to 3000 yrds.  The barrel has a star-gauged mark at the six-oclock on the muzzle, and is dated "SA 2-38".  The muzzle and throat wear measure near "0", making this an almost new (little shot) barrel.  The stock cartoughes indicate that SA has rebuilt this at least once (thus the new barrel).

column1: For Sale:  1903-A4 Remington WWII sniper rifle
column10: This is an original WWII 1903-A4 sniper rifle made by Remington in .30-06.  Two batches of A4s were made, the second smaller batch (2920 rifles) were stamped with a "Z" prefix to the serial number.  This rifle falls within this smaller, more rare batch.  The rifle is topped with an original, correct "Weaver M-8" marked scope with a correct post-crosshair reticle.  The parkerized base is correctly marked "Redfield" on the right-rear, and the rings match in color.  The bolt is polished for smoother operation, and the stock is the correct "warthog" modified C design.  There are no cartoughes, which is correct for the rifle.  The barrel is marked "RA 9-43".

column1: For Sale:  AR-15 18" SS bbl w/scope, new
column10: This is a new LRB (of M14 fame) rifle with a medium heavy 18" stainless steel barrel.  It has a rigid ACE skeletal stock for sturdiness, but light weight character.  The scope is a Bushnell 3x9x50, and is mounted with sniper grade HD high rings.  Comes with one mag.This would make a great intermediate sniper rifle and coyote hunter.Additional accessories (ammo, mags, cleaning kit, etc.) available upon request.No trades at this time.

column1: For Sale:  AR-15, 16" Aero Precision, new
column10: This is a new unfired (except at the factory) 16" M4 carbine made by Aero Precision.  All of their rifles are chambered in the .223 Wylde, cycling std .223 and 5.56 equally.  It has AP's Enhanced 2nd generation designed upper and lower receivers.  The upper is beefed up, with an extended area over the proprietary barrel nut.  This allows the handguard to be bolted directly to the upper receiver with 8 screws.  This gives a bomb-proof attachment and a perfect alignment between the rail and receiver.The lower receiver has been drilled and tapped for a tention screw for mating the upper and lower.  Aero was the first to do this; eliminating the free play (wobble) between the upper and lower receivers.  All the furniture is MagPul.  Comes with one mag.Additional accessories (ammo, sights, scopes, cleaning kits, etc.) available upon request.No trades at this time.

column1: For Sale:  Kimber 1911, Ultra Carry .45 LNIB

column1: For Sale:  1911, 45 ACP Smith & Wesson, NIB
column10: This is a new, unfired (except at the factory) 1911 made by Smith & Wesson.  It is a full government size (5" bbl.), blued carbon steel.  S&W stopped making all carbon steel 1911s about 10 yrs ago.  When the Colt patent ran out, and S&W started making 1911s, they contracted with Chip McCormick to make all of their enhanced upgrades: ie. safeties, slide stops, trigger, sights, guide rods, etc.  So what you end up with is a great combat pistol; as is, out of the box.  This pistol will shoot full loads all day long without beating you up, nor itself (as will happen with alloy and stainless steel guns; not to mention plastic guns).Additional accessories (ammo, holsters, cleaning kits, etc.) available upon request.

column10: AR15 7.5" PISTOL Upper NEW NEVER FIRED ---- Stainless Steel Wylde Barrel in Black Nitride ----7075 FORGED ALUMINUMHARD ANODIZEDPISTOL LENGTH GAS SYSTEM LOW PROFILE STEEL GAS BLOCK AND SS GAS TUBE7.5 " BARREL (SS BARREL WITH BLACK NITRIDE COATING) .223 Wylde Chamber (the best)7" KEYMOD HANDGUARD CLAMP ON STYLEKRINK KAN MUZZLE BREAK - SOUND FORWARD DEVICE (OR REMOVE CONE FOR FIRE BALL MODE)PICATINNY RAILMAGPUL AVG2 ANGLED HAND GRIPAMBIDEXTROUS CHARGING HANDLEABOUT THE 223 WYLDE CHAMBER;The .223 Wylde is a hybrid .223/.556 chamber designed by Bill Wylde to yield the accuracy advantages of the match .223 Remington commercial chambering but without the pressure or reliability failures when using high velocity 5.56 NATO spec ammunition. The .223 Wylde achieves better accuracy by having a chamber throat that is tighter than 5.56, but will still function reliably with military 5.56 ammunition because case dimensions are the same. These facts lead to the .223 Wylde having SUPERIOR target and varmint accuracy, a compatibility with all .223 and 5.56 NATO ammunition and being a top choice for competition shootrs. (Wilson Combat 2017)EMAIL OR TEXT FOR MORE PICS ETCBRIAN 505-221-4704

For sale is a custom sig P320 (compact-15 round magazine). Slide has been custom milled for Trijicon RMR and coated with PVD finish (more wear resistant than cerakote type finishes). Frame has had custom stipple job and has been cerakote sniper gray color. Inforce APLc light has also been cerakote sniper gray to match frame. Also include are 2 15 round sig p320 magazines and a custom black multicam condura Kydex holster made to fit Inforce weapon light. If you prefer to NOT have the Inforce light i also have an identical holster (black multicam kydex) that I will include as well (it will fit P320 without light on). So you will have holsters to accommodate gun with and without light. Original price (not including Trijicon RMR) is over 1800 for slide work, frame work, coating, custom holsters, and weapon light. I am asking 900.00 for the whole package (NOT including RMR)... i can include RMR for total price of 1300Total package:- custom milled P320 slide with PVD finish- custom stippled & cerakote frame (sniper gray)- cerakote Inforce APLc weapon light- Gray guns flat faced P320 trigger (TiN coated-titanium nitride)- Barrel has been TiN coated- Slide stop has been TiN coated- Custom kydex holster (black multicam) for P320 with attached light- custom Kydex holster (black multicam) for P320 WITHOUT attached light- total of 4 15 round magazines$850

column1: For Sale:  Custom turkey Remington 870 Super Magnum
column10: I have a Remington 870 Super Magnum that I'm thinking about letting go. Full detail and specs listed below. I bought this shotgun new, and have put less than 100 rounds through it.  I wanted to make the perfect turkey shotgun, and I think this is it!  But sadly, I don't see myself getting out turkey hunting anymore in the near future. I'm looking to trade it for a semi auto .308Win (PTR-91, M1A, YUGO M77 AK VARIANT, SAIGA or VEPR .308, etc.  NO AR-10s!). Also interested in an Arsenal SLR-107F (folding stock with no rail), or other high end AK-47s in 7.62x39.  Or even a Ruger Model 77 chambered in .44Magnum (Ruger 77/44).  No other trades unless it's interesting.-camo 870 Super Magnum (2 3/4", 3", and 3 1/2" shells)-28" barrel-extra full turkey choke-Hogue 870 rubber forearm-Mesa Tactica optics rail-Mesa Tactical AR stock adapter-Hogue AR rubber grip-Double Star Skeleton AR stock-original furniture-Can include the NEW Vortex Strikefire II red dot for the right trade (red and green dot with multiple brightness settings)Will also listen to cash offers. All low-ball offers will be ignored.  Before you make an offer, please understand how much this stuff costs.  And no, it's NOT $0, so don't ask. All scammers will be reported to the proper authorities.This would also make a slick slug gun just by swapping barrels to a fully rifled slug barrel!

It's warrantied, but just haven't had the time to get them to send me out a new lever.  I'm asking $900 cash. It also has a classically configured, cut-checkered American walnut stock.

column1: For Sale:  Parker Bros. 12 Gauge Grade 2 SXS shotgun
column10: Inventory # G-53714-1Manufacturer: Parker Bros.Model: Top Lever HammerCaliber: 12 gaugeNew / Used: UsedCondition: This top lever hammer shotgun is a Grade 2 (G) and appears to all be original. Serial number research indicates a build year of 1887. The barrels are fine three-grade Damascus steel, 30” length, and measure to be choked Improved Cylinder. They ring true and have a light amount of bluing left on the patina finish. There are two light dings in the barrels within 8” of the muzzle. The bores show light to moderate pitting.The receiver, hammers, and dogleg top lever still have strong engraving. The side plates have light case color visible. The stock and forend are solid without cracks; original checkering is worn smooth but quite visible. There is a ½” long repaired area in the butt plate of some type of filler material. The wood does have small nicks and dings one would expect of a gun of this ilk, but nothing significant. The action locks up very tight without any hint of wiggle or loose fit. This is superb example of an honest side-by-side shotgun with character.We have additional higher resolution pictures of this item available upon request.Call or come by Green Country Arms & Pawn in Tulsa, OK, (9075 E 31st St, Tulsa, OK). column1: For Sale:  Les Baer 1911 Ultimate Tactical Carry 45 ACP
column10: No trades considered - Cash or USPS money orders onlyLes Baer Ultimate Tactical Carry in 45 ACP that has a round count of 650. Night sights are still bright and the slide to frame finish is very tight. You will need a bushing wrench. Comes in the original Les Baer box with 3x mags, a lock and some misc LB promotional paperwork. Finish is in excellent condition with wear only at the thumb safety and slide stop (from normal use). There is an extremely faint scratch on the frame from the slide stop (you have to hold it just right to even see it). This gun was never carried; it was a range gun only.I will split the Oregon FFL transfer cost up to $20. This excludes the Oregon State Police background check of $10. I know of several places that will do transfers for $25-$30. Will drive to Vancouver, WA to sell it. Will ship it for extra. Contact me via the site or text me at 971- two one nine – 1015The new Baer Ultimate Tactical Carry pistol is a serious self defense pistol, designed by firearms professionals who teach others to survive in a dangerous world. This distinctive pistol is extremely practical and includes virtually everything you need and nothing you don't. That makes it an exceptional value, as well as a dependable companion that you'll own and trust for a lifetime. Features include* Baer steel NM frame * Baer steel NM slide with front and rear serrations * Slide fitted to frame * Baer NM barrel with stainless match bushing * LBC deluxe fixed combat rear sight with tritium inserts * Baer dovetail front sight with tritium insert * Lowered and flared ejection port * Baer checkered slide stop * Baer extended ejector * Combat extended safety * Baer aluminum match trigger * Baer deluxe Commander hammer and sear * Crisp 4 lb. pull * Baer tuned extractor * Baer beavertail grip safety with pad * High checkered front strap @ 30 lpi * flat checkered mainspring housing at 20 lpi * Beveled magazine well * Polished feed ramp and throated barrel * complete pistol rounded for tactical use * blued finish on complete pistol * Deluxe special slim line grips * (3) stainless steel 8-round premium magazines

column1: For Sale:  Winchester High Wall w/Ron Long Barrel 32-40 Stk #A407
column10: This is a Winchester high wall falling block rifling chambered for 32-40. The 30” bluedRon Longbarrel has a 1-¼” straight octagonal profile and is ingood condition. There are few scattered hairline scratches in the otherwise undamaged finish.  Thebore is in excellent conditionwith sharp, undamaged rifling. A dovetail is cut for a front sight, but currently holds one of three scope blocks mounted to the barrel. The blued receiver is ingood condition. There is a scratch on the right side that runs into the forend and a small spot of pitting on the left side. The hammer, breech block, and lever are also blued. This rifle has an adjustable single set trigger. TheP+++ walnutforend and buttstock are in good condition. The buttstock has a chip out of the grip cap and several scattered light scratches but none disturb the semiglossy finish. The forend with schnabel has a scratch on the right side coming off the receiver, but is otherwise undamaged. The buttstock has a raised cheek rest, a checkered buttplate, and a rosewood grip cap with a concave diamond shaped inlay. Length of pull is 14”, overall length is 46-½”, and weight is 14.2 lbs. Our stock number #A407. Willing to ship anywhere in the US, buyer pays freight and insurance.

column1: For Sale:  Winchester High Wall Schuetzen 32-40 Stk #A406
column10: This is a Winchester high wall falling block rifle chambered for 32-40. The 29” octagon to round barrel gently is tapered from 1-1/8“ at the receiver to 1” at the muzzle. The blued finish is inexcellent condition, having no scratches or corrosion. The bore is in excellent condition withsharp, clean rifling. A dovetail is cut for a front sight and two scope blocks are mounted on the top flat of the octagonal portion of the barrel. The color cased self cocking receiver is also in good condition. There areno scratches or corrosion, but the finish has some wear on the left side and there are some small dings on the right side. The hammer, breech block, lever and trigger are also color cased.   TheP+++ walnutforend and buttstock are in good condition. The buttstock has a semi pistol grip, a raised cheek rest, and a German silver schuetzen buttplate. There is a small chip out of the bottom of the grip and a ½” scratch on the right side of the wrist.  The forend has an ebony inlay on the schnabel and is undamaged aside from a tiny ding on the left side. Length of pull is 13”, overall length is 48”, and weight is 11.8 lbs. Our stock number is #A406. Willing to ship anywhere in the US, buyer pays freight and insurance.

Willing to ship anywhere in the US to your FFL, buyer pays freight and insurance.

column1: For Sale:  Steyr Mannlicher Schoenauer Model 1952 30-06 Stk #A333
column10: This is a Steyr Mannlicher Schoenauer Model 1952 chambered for 30-06. The 20” blued barrel is ingood condition. There are a few scratches in the finish but no corrosion. The bore has some roughness but the rifling is still sharp. The front sight is a fixed bead set in a ramped dovetail and the rear sight is fixed, but has a secondary folding sight set for 300 meters. The receiver is also ingood conditionhaving very little finish wear and no corrosion. The receiver has beendrilled and tappedfor a scope mount and currently holds a Weaver V4.5-1 on a side folding Pachmayr mount. The bolt has finish wear where it slided in the receiver and on the bolt handle, but there is no corrosion.  The bolt safety cannot be flipped when the scope is over the receiver, so asecondary safety has been installedon the right side of the receiver. The walnut full stock with pistol grip is in good condition. There are some small dings scattered throughout, but few disrupt the finish.The floor plate is stamped with Stoeger’s import mark. The stock has checkering at the wrist and forend, sling swivels, and a 1” rubber recoil pad. Length of pull is 13-½”, overall length is 40”, and weight is 8.4 lbs. Our stock number is #A333. Willing to ship anywhere in the US to your FFL, buyer pays freight and insurance.

The Kel-Tec CMR-30 Rifle is chambered for the .22WMR cartridge (22 Magnum). The design is a rifle version of the popular Kel-Tec PMR-30 pistol. The same 30 round magazines are used. The single action trigger mechanism, bolt stop, ambidextrous safety levers, and mag catch are also identical. The CMR-30 rifle includes a collapsible stock and the 16” barrel is threaded 1/2”-28 to accept many different muzzle attachments. The multi-position collapsible stock allows for a short overall length of 22.7” with the stock collapsed, and 30.6” when extended. The long top picatinny rail will accept a multitude of different optics, and the removable under picatinny rail is included. The ambidextrous operating handles are non-reciprocating and latch in the forward position. The stock latch lever is also ambidextrous and located just in front of the trigger guard. An integral sling loop is included near the rear of the grip, on both sides. The CMR-30 is constructed of hard-coat anodized aluminum for the upper assembly and rails and houses the steel barrel. The collapsible stock is made with aluminum stock rods, and a nylon butt plate. The stock was designed to have a natural cheek weld when extended. The grip, mag catch, safety levers, stock latch, and operating handles are made of glass reinforced nylon (Zytel). The grip houses the frame which is made of aluminum. The bolt assembly houses a captive recoil spring assembly. Magpul® flip-up sights included. The extensive use of aluminum, and a lock time lower than most bolt action rifles makes the CMR-30 a very accurate rifle.

This is a low serial number 4144, Federal Ordnance M14. Serial number 4144, was built with USGI internal parts, numbers have been verified, with the exception of the barrel which is a chrome lined CMP stamped barrel dated 1961.The stock is in excellent condition and the barrel has the bayonet lug. Please see the pictures for details and if you require additional pictures or information you can follow this link to our GunsAmerica store where we have 20+ pictures of the rifle "https://www.gunsamerica.com/997385454/FEDERAL-ORDNANCE-IN.htm"  I have included information on Federal Ordnance.Background information on Federal Ordnance, Inc. from M14 Rifle History and Development Third Edition by Lee Emerson copyright 2006:"A. R. Sales Co., National Ordnance, Inc. and Federal Ordnance, Inc.A. R. Sales Co. was established in 1968 and owned by Ilia I. Karnes. Jack Karnes, his wife Ilia, and their two children ran the company. Mr. Karnes was a tool and die maker by trade. When the family business started, its first large contract was to make M16 scope mounts. The two letters, A.R., were taken from the first two alphanumeric characters of the commercial name for the M16 rifle. Next, A. R. Sales produced high-end lightweight alloy M1911 style pistol frames and accessories.It appears that A. R. Sales started on the semi-automatic M14 type rifle project by October 1971. An advertisement for its Mark IV rifle appeared in the October 15, 1971, issue of Shotgun News. The response from the civilian market was overwhelming. This included 2000 or more mail-in orders with the $15.00 deposit for a stripped Mark IV receiver.A. R. Sales received its initial batch of Mark IV receiver castings by no later than March 07, 1972. This first set of receivers were used by Jack Karnes to set up fixtures and tooling for the machine tools. There were two Mark IV receiver production lots for the company. The first occurred in the winter of 1973. The first Mark IV rifles and stripped receivers were delivered to customers in January 1973. Mark IV serial number 0143 had been delivered to the buyer on March 02, 1973. The first production lot of Mark IV receivers was cast at Rimer Casting Company (Waterville, OH) using Karl Maunz’s receiver master die according to two sources and Prico (Los Angeles, CA) according to a third source, all highly reputable. The first production lot of Mark IV receivers was machined by A. R. Sales. The first lot of receiver serial numbers ended somewhere between 0001 and 0225 with 200 receivers produced.The second receiver production lot was made in 1976. The receiver serial numbers for the second lot were started at a number below 0226 and ended at number 0250. The second production batch of Mark IV receivers was cast at Gray-Syracuse, Inc. and machined by Valley Ordnance Co. About twenty-five receivers were produced in the second batch.Twenty-five serial numbers were skipped between the first lot and the second lot. The missing serial numbers were allotted for tool room samples and for intended-but-never-realized forged receivers. Both production lots of Mark IV receivers were heat treated by a local company in southern California.A. R. Sales Co. at first bought M14 parts brand new directly from USGI contractors. Mark IV rifles were assembled with new and used USGI M14 parts and USGI M14 wood stocks. Any used M14 parts that were broken or worn were compared to the USGI drawings and rejected in the build procedure. The stock selector cutout was filled in for each assembled Mark IV rifle. According to the October 1971 A. R. Sales Co. specification sheet for the Mark IV rifle, “While most of our rifles will be built with N.M. barrels, we do not glass bed the actions, nor do we produce match grade weapons. We feel that this is best left to those who specialize in accurizing and building match grade weapons, and we do not wish to infringe in their domain.”

column1: For Sale:  Springfield Armory M1 Garand 1942 Danish Lend/Lease w/Danish Bayonet!
column10: CLICK HERE FOR PICTURE LINK!!!SPRINGFIELD ARMORY M1 GARAND SER# 575099. MARCH 1942 DANISH LEND/LEASEDenmark received 69,810 M1 rifles (designated "Gevær m/50") from the US government prior to 1964. Some were converted to the 7.62x51mm NATO cartridge(this one is NOT). Also purchased 20,000 M1s from Italy. That is why you will see Breda or Beretta made parts on some of them. The CMP got these back in the 90's.This is a CMP Service Grade M1 garand that has alot of correct parts on it. It is from 2012. The barrel gauges like brand new. Here is the parts breakdown:Stock- No cartouche, but has the serial number stamped into the stock in 3 places. Correct on Danish rifles. Also has the original "data" tag/sticker in the barrel channel with the rifles info. Also has the "Home Guard" stock disc telling the year of service as 1957.Barrel- 2-51 dated. The muzzle reads 1.25, Throat reads 1.5. Those readings are like a brand new barrel!Op Rod- D35282 End of/Very Early Post WW2Bolt - -12 SA Heat Lot Code SB 7 with a diamondGas Cylinder- SAGas Cylinder Screw- TGas Cylinder Lock- WW2 with MRear Sight- Type 3 LockbarTrigger Housing- -5 SAHammer- -2 SASafety- -9 SAFollower- 12Clip Latch- RoundedFollower Rod- Stamped Type 4A great representative of a Lend/Lease that is certain to have seen service in WW2 because we gave them to the Danes right after the war! Comes with CMP certificate.$1,200.00 plus tax in Vermont or actual shipping outside Vermont. Must go to an 03 FFL or better. column1: For Sale:  Semi-Auto Sniper Rifle w/ LPS-4x Scope...
column10: Here's a Romanian PSL-54C semi-automatic rifle. Sometimes called the "FPK Dragunov", this weapon was designed to engage targets that were out of range for the standard infantry rifle. It is chambered for the powerful 7.62x54R cartridge and wears a 24.4" barrel with chrome lined 4-groove bore and 1/12.5 twist. It is a closely related to the RPK and has a thick walled receiver with reinforced trunnion. The action is pure Kalashnikov, just scaled up for the heavier cartridge. The corrugated steel buttplate is spring dampened to help absorb recoil. All serial numbered parts are matching with the exception of the fire-control components (hammer, sear, selector). The rifle is in very good condition with some handling wear including some minor scratches to the matte black finish. There is no rust or pitting. The stocks are in very good shape with some normal handling wear, dents and small scuffs...but no cracks or chips. The rifle appear to be in good mechanical condition and the bore is in good shape as well. It comes complete with the correct/very good condition LPS-4x Type 2 scope with ranging reticle. The scope attaches to the left side receiver rail with a quick detach mount. One 10-round magazine is included. This rifle should be lots of fun to shoot!

Chambered in 28GA up to 2-3/4", 28" barrels, and a 14.75" LOP. Best premier grade shotgun for the money hands down! Manufacturers description as follows--"Previously chosen by the Editors of Field and Stream Magazine as “Best of the Best” in Shotguns, the Tempio is designed to be a sleek and fast pointing shotgun in the field; the perfect companion for upland game hunters. Its low-profile receiver matched with a trim stock, classic Prince-of-Wales grip and Schnabel fore-end make the gun a perfect match for fast game birds. The Tempio features a contemporary style of “ornato” style scroll with tasteful gold accents. The action is further enhanced by a hand polished coin finish protected by our proprietary Invisalloy™ coating. Each Caesar Guerini game gun is carefully engineered to balance near the hinge point, distributing the weight evenly between the hands, which is the secret to a finely crafted shotgun. The Tempio also features a deluxe grade of Turkish walnut enhanced with a hand rubbed oil finish. All Caesar Guerini field guns come with a velvet lined lockable hard case and five precision patterned flush chokes (CYL, IC, M, IM, F). A plastic choke case is also included." THIS GUN IS IN EXCELLENT NEW CONDITION

column10: I have an Egyptian Maadi ARM rifle available for local sale or trade in Cheyenne, WY.This rifle was imported by ACC/INTRAC of Knoxville, TN from 1993 to 1995.  It is an authentic factory-built Egyptian import (NOT one of the problematic Century Arms MISR rifles) and is one of the best AKM rifles available.  It is one of the only semi-automatic Kalashnikovs imported into the United States that, in almost every regard, is an exact duplicate of the Russian AKM.According to SOF's Peter Kokalis in the late 1990s, these Maadi rifles are as close as you can get to a real Russian AKM on the U.S. civilian market.  The manufacturer (Factory 54, Maadi Company for Engineering Industries, Cairo, Egypt) used genuine Russian equipment, detailed Russian technical training, and assembly oversight by Soviet engineers from Izhevsk.This rifle is in excellent condition and fitted with a Magpul Zhukov-S folding stock, Magpul Zhukov hand guard, ATI finger-groove pistol grip, and Troy Industries Medieval removable flash suppressor.

Up for sale is a rare and unique Winchester 1894 lever action in 30WCF. Serial # puts it built in 1905... Somewhere along the line the octagon barrel was professionally turned down in spots, leaving a very unique 1894. Immediately after the rear sight the octagon barrel was turned down to a round profile which extends to the front sight, going back to octagon the length of the front sight and tapering back to rounded at the bore. Rifle is in fair condition for the age of and is functional. Rifle sold as is and  can be picked up in person or will be shipped in a hard case to your FFL. Buyer pays actual shipping cost..

column1: For Sale:  Rare 1952 FN Belgium 98 Commercial Mauser .270
column10: Here is a very rare to find model 1952 FN Belgium commercial made 98 mauser in .270. I believe this rifle dates 52' to 55'. original Chrome vanadium barrel with appropriate stamps, nice shiney bore. I believe the Rifle is in a custom built flame maple stock. Maybe was built in the 60's or 70's? Seems to be made in the general dimensions of the original fn mauser commercial stocks? might be original as well, maybe a custom factory stock? cant verify this? But the rifle has age to it, and that I can verify. rifle shows nice blue still with the tip of the barrel showing the most wear from years of use, see pics. rifle has been upgraded with a timney trigger and shoots factory fodder 150g soft points at 1" all day long, rifle has even logged a few 0.60 and .75 3 shot groups in the past few weeks since Ive been shooting it. (would definitely shoot better with handloads an premium bullets!) will come with original trigger. Comes with simmons 3.5x20x44 scope in luepold mounts. an awesome opportunity to own a rare shooter/ hunter grade commercial mauser 98. column1: For Sale:  1943 K98 Mauser, German Markings, Custom Sporter!
column10: Here is a 1943 CE marked K98 Mauser Custom sporter. This is a JP Sauer and sohn made rifle. This rifle was a vet bring back rifle that was converted to a sporter in the 60's by a Custom Builder.This rifle has all matching serial numbers (with exception of the bolt.) Common with bring back Mauser K98's from what Ive read. This rifle retains all of its war eagle stamps on barrel, receiver and bolt end. Rarer to find Taper down barrel from what I read. I assume this rifle to be at stock 7.97X57 8mm mauser caliber as the barrel is not marked with caliber. Cannot verify this, so new owner will need to verify caliber with a gun smith (before firing). Semi verified this chamber to be 8mm with appropriate 8mm snap cap round (selling this rifle for a friend of the fam who has limited knowledge of rifles, sorry for the lack of info) rifle condition is nice. blue is around 95%, bore is shiny. wood stock shows a little wear here and there, a few nips around rear sling stud area (see pics) but generally nice for its age. It is assumed this rifle was sporterized in the late 50's early 60's by age of stock pad. Overall a very nice ww2 era K98 sporter that can be hunted. Rifle was scoped with a junker tasco and used yearly on Dear hunts according to pictures I saw. removed scope myself, (will include original weaver scope bases with rifle.) Was definitively this Vets cherished Hunting weapon! ask questions? see pics. pretty vintage piece! Im not an FFL holder, so make sure your FFL is fine taking in a weapon from a private individual. Your FFL's paper work will need to be supplied upon sale of this weapon. located in casper wy, I can accept paypal, postal money order and certified bank draft. txt or call 307-267-8522
